articles.description: PETE JENSON IN SPAIN: With his ally and former president Joan Laporta preparing his first summer back in charge, Messi is as relaxed about his future as at any time since 2017.
articles.content:
Lionel Messi's head is clear and his legs are rested, and that can only be bad news for the two other teams in the Spanish title race. 
With his ally and former president Joan Laporta now preparing … [+3887 chars]

articles.author: Adam Schrader, Holden Walter-warner, Alex Raskin Sports, Associated
articles.title: 'Congratulations to MLB for taking a stand': Barack Obama praises league for moving All-Star Game - Daily Mail
articles.description: Former President Barack Obama is among those praising MLB for removing the All-Star Game from Georgia, with Donald Trump standing on the opposite side of the fence.
articles.content: Former President Barack Obama has praised Major League Baseball for its decision to pull its All-Star Game from Georgia over the state's new voting law, as Republican governor Brian Kemp slammed the … [+27679 chars]

articles.title: Jurgen Klopp slammed for going "too far" with Trent Alexander-Arnold comments - Mirror Online
articles.description: The Liverpool boss criticised Gareth Southgate's decision to leave Reds right-back Alexander-Arnold out of the most recent England squad
articles.content:
Jurgen Klopp went "too far" by criticising Gareth Southgate's decision to leave Trent Alexander-Arnold out of the last England squad, according to Tony Cascarino.
